channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Perl Developer who wants to learn Scala and NodeJS - West London
item.description: Love Perl but want to skill-up on another stack at your employerâ€™s expense? Client is a major and dynamics UK company with a large (and pretty Modern) Perl codebase who have started extended their technical stack to include Scala and NodeJS.

item.title: Perl Mongers of Wimbledon Common Are We - Perl Developer wanted in Wimbledon
item.description: Back in the day, the Wombles of Wimbledon collected rubbish. Nowadays, since the advent of motorised road sweepers, theyâ€™d be in need of a new profession. Perl Developer, perhaps? Our client is based in the heart of Wimbledon, under a mile away from the Common where the Wombles famously made their home.

item.title: Looking for your first real programming job? Junior role for a hobbyist PHP or JavaScript developer interested in Perl
item.description: Are you a graduate or school-leaver with some programming knowledge, who wants to take their first step into a programming career? My Oxford-based client are a very successful SaaS business willing to take on and mentor promising junior programmers whose programming experience has so far just been a hobby or a programming bootcamp.

item.title: Testing a tree data structure in Perl
Episode 13: Interview with Damian Conway, designer of Perl 6 programming language
item.description: Pramod interviewed Damian Conway. Interview is available as an audio and transcript, both.

item.title: No, it is not a compiler error. It is never a compiler error.
item.description: Spoiler alert: It was a compiler error.

item.title: London.PM at a glance
item.description: Mohammad shared his experience at London.pm meeting ("PM" stands for "Perl Mongers").

item.title: YAPC::Russia 2017
item.description: Viacheslav shared his experience at YAPC::Russia, 2017.

item.title: London Perl Workshop 2017 - Curtain Raiser
item.description: Mohammad S Anwar wrote about his experience as a speaker last year at LPW & his future plans regarding LPW this year.

item.title: The Great London Perl Bake Off
item.description: Do you know how to bake? Are you going to attend London Perl Workshop? If yes, then you might be able to help Neil.

item.title: Shiny New Toys at the London Perl Workshop, Nov 25th
item.description: Are you still in doubt about attending London Perl Workshop? Read this summary of the event & you will be convinced that you should attend it.

item.title: 2017.45 Uplink Established
item.description: Liz brings us a nice summary of happenings in the Perl6 world.

item.title: What's new on CPAN - October 2017
item.description: David Farrell tells us about the CPAN modules released last month.

item.title: Perl Taster Course
item.description: Dave Cross wrote a very detailed article giving introduction of Perl.

item.title: I want my, I want my Kwa-li-tee
item.description: Nick tells us how he improved Kwalitee rating for his module and probably you should do the same.

item.title: Inline::F2003 - An ILSM for modern FORTRAN
item.description: If you want to know how to compile FORTRAN embedded in Perl, then check out Ron's Perl module.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: #329 - The London Perl Workshop & confectionery
item.description:
Hi everyone,

London Perl Workshop looks so tempting. Unfortunately, I can't go, but you should go if you can.

Also, Neil is looking for three more bakers for London Perl workshop. So, if you want to help the community & show off your baking skills, then this is a golden chance for you.

I hope you will enjoy reading as much as I enjoyed writing this edition of Perl Weekly.
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
